page.title: 04LEATON KNOLLS CONT'D.
page.content: BUILDINGS & LANDSCAPE. Buildings are scattered along the main road;settlements are far too small to qualify as villages.The local material is probably red sandstone,as many cottages use this at least as a base.Some of the larger houses are nineteenth century,painted white.Both of these types of buildings were originally built for farm _ labourers.There are some modern bungalows built for commuters. The landscape is dominated by farmland and a mixture of deciduous and evergreen trees,some of which line the main road.for most of the way hedgerows line the road,with some metal fencing.The landscape is reasonably flat.The Welsh border hills can be seen from Upper Berwick farm.Local people apreciate the quiet,pleasant,gentle scenery.
